Warwick.Silas Clapp House: The Silas Clapp House is an historic house at East Greenwich Avenue in West Warwick, Rhode Island. The 2-1/2 story wood frame house was built in 1804 by Silas Clapp, who farmed a 100-acre (40 ha) parcel of land surrounding the house. It is a well-preserved example of vernacular Federal styling, with a five-bay main facade and a central entry with fanlight.
